item.title: Disney Cracking Down on Bad Behavior, Entire Family Removed
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: Disneyland, often referred to as the ‚ÄúHappiest Place on Earth,‚Äù is a world-renowned theme Park known for its magical attractions and unforgettable experiences. However, even in this enchanting realm, the all-too-familiar frustration of dealing with line cutters can cast a shadow over the joyous atmosphere. Line cutters, those individuals who bypass queues and disregard the ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Disneyland, often referred to as the ‚ÄúHappiest Place on Earth,‚Äù is a world-renowned theme Park known for its magical attractions and unforgettable experiences. However, even in this enchanting realm, the all-too-familiar frustration of dealing with line cutters can cast a shadow over the joyous atmosphere. Line cutters, those individuals who bypass queues and disregard the patience of fellow park-goers, create an unfortunate dilemma that challenges the very essence of fairness and shared enjoyment.

Credit: Disney

Disneyland, the iconic theme Park founded by Walt Disney himself, stands as a testament to imagination, creativity, and the power of storytelling. Disneyland Resort is home to captivating attractions, beloved characters, and immersive experiences. The Park has etched itself into the hearts of millions as a place where dreams truly come to life.

Disneyland is home to two different Parks: Disneyland Park features iconic attractions such as Jungle Cruise, Haunted Mansion, Big Thunder Mountain Railroad, ‚Äúit‚Äôs a small world,‚Äù Space Mountain, Star Wars Rise of the Resistance, and Dumbo the Flying Elephant; Guests can also spot Sleeping Beauty Castle on Main Street, U.S.A. Disneyland‚Äôs other Park is Disney California Adventure Park. This Park features thrilling attractions such as Incredicoaster, Radiator Springs Racers, Soarin‚Äô Around the World, Goofy‚Äôs Sky School, Guardians of the Galaxy‚Äì Mission BREAKOUT!, and much more.

Credit: Disney

With all of these magical moments, Guests and families, friends, and individuals of all ages flock to the Parks to create lasting memories. Waiting in line is an integral part of the Disneyland experience, fostering anticipation and excitement as Guests inch closer to their chosen attraction.

In a social media post, a family was caught line-cutting when another Guest told a Cast Member as the family was boarding Space Mountain. This Disneyland Cast Member leaped into action by removing the family from the attraction. While line-cutting is not uncommon at Disney Parks, Guests should remember to be kind to others around them.

‚ÄúCM was unaware and loaded them into the ride vehicle as a group. I let her know what they did and she kicked them all out of the ride,‚Äù a Guest shared.

Disneyland recognizes the importance of Guest satisfaction and works diligently to manage the issue of line cutting. Park staff are trained to address such instances with professionalism and tact, ensuring that the disruptive behavior is curtailed without causing further disturbances.

How do you feel about the line cutters?

item.title: For Better or Worse, Darth Vader is Officially BACK
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: Mega-fans of the Star Wars galactic film franchise as well as casually informed audiences and even people not well-versed in movies, know precisely who the villainous Darth Vader is. He‚Äôs famously Luke‚Äôs father, for one. He‚Äôs the all-black-wearing, James Earl Jones-voiced, evil Force Master who makes at least a dozen appearances on any given Halloween. ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Mega-fans of the Star Wars galactic film franchise as well as casually informed audiences and even people not well-versed in movies, know precisely who the villainous Darth Vader is. He‚Äôs famously Luke‚Äôs father, for one. He‚Äôs the all-black-wearing, James Earl Jones-voiced, evil Force Master who makes at least a dozen appearances on any given Halloween. And he‚Äôs bAaAaCk! Here‚Äôs how to re-experience Darth Vader in Ahsoka on Disney Plus.

Credit: Lucasfilm, Disney+

All Star Wars fans can discuss today is the newly released trailer for the upcoming and highly anticipated Disney Plus streaming series Ahsoka starring Rosario Dawson. This new 45-second teaser trailer ominously begins with the line, ‚ÄúEveryone in the Order knew Anakin Skywalker, few would live to see what he became‚Ä¶‚Äù

Played by actor Hayden Christensen in the three Star Wars prequels, Anakin Skywalker is a Jedi Knight who turned to the Dark Side of the Force, becoming Darth Vader under the influence of the evil Emperor Palpatine. Anakin becomes the iconic Sith Lord and one of the primary antagonists in the original trilogy after a grisly battle with Obi-Wan Kenobi and murdering Mace Windu. Vader played a significant role in the rise and fall of the Galactic Empire.

Credit: Lucasfilm

Disney Plus‚Äô Ahsoka series picks up the story after the Clone Wars, and even though Lord Vader has already died at this point, we know that Anakin Skywalker was Ahsoka‚Äôs Jedi Master. She admits walking away from him, and the Jedi in the new teaser, and then the bomb drops.

Newly recorded dialogue from Hayden Christensen as Anakin weaves into the iconic, dramatic theme score. He says, ‚ÄúIn this war, you will face more than just droids. As your Master, it‚Äôs my responsibility to prepare you. I won‚Äôt always be there to look out for you. Don‚Äôt be afraid. Trust your instincts. I know you can do this, Ahsoka.‚Äù

Watch for yourself below!

New teaser for ‚ÄòAHSOKA‚Äô, featuring Hayden Christensen voicing Anakin Skywalker. pic.twitter.com/rIeK46GGuW

‚Äî DiscussingFilm (@DiscussingFilm) August 13, 2023

What role do you think Anakin will play in the series? Will he only be featured in flashbacks of Ahsoka‚Äôs Padawan days? Will he return as a Force ghost to warn her about Admiral Thrawn and the Sith Lords she will be facing? Both??

Fans can‚Äôt wait to find out!

Disney Plus‚Äô Ahsoka series has its two-episode premiere in just 10 days on August 23! See you there, Star Wars Universe!

item.title: Driverless Busses Coming Soon to Orlando Theme Parks
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: If you‚Äôre getting around in downtown Orlando, you‚Äôll soon have another transportation option at your disposal. If driving in the heart of the city sounds like a nightmare to you then you‚Äôre in luck because Orlando has recently unveiled a way to get around that‚Äôs unlike any other. Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer hosted a luncheon ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
If you‚Äôre getting around in downtown Orlando, you‚Äôll soon have another transportation option at your disposal. If driving in the heart of the city sounds like a nightmare to you then you‚Äôre in luck because Orlando has recently unveiled a way to get around that‚Äôs unlike any other. Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer hosted a luncheon recently to promote the city‚Äôs newest transportation method and discuss the possibility for the future.

Credit: Lake Nona

Introducing Swan, the self-driving bus! The city of Orlando has partnered with Beep to bring a futuristic public transportation option to the heart of the city. Beep is a next generation transportation company that produces both public and private shuttles in a forward-looking and environmentally friendly way. All Beep shuttles are fully automated and electric. The city of Orlando partnered with the self-driving vehicle company to bring one of their shuttles to Orlando and it is set to debut on August 20, 2023.¬†

Credit: Lake Nona

During the luncheon Orlando Mayor Dyer along with Orange County Mayor Jerry Demmings showed off the new shuttle and revealed that it would be called the Swan Shuttle. The small white bus will circle the street of Creative Village in a route that will take approximately 15 minutes. Even more exciting, it will be completely free!¬†

Jacques Coulon, Orlando‚Äôs Transportation Planning Manager said, ‚ÄúOnce it‚Äôs running, ride it. But don‚Äôt just ride it, give us feedback,‚Äù ‚ÄúWe want to know what did you love about it, what didn‚Äôt feel quite right, what we need to adjust. Transit only works when it‚Äôs comfortable, accessible and more convenient than driving your car.‚Äù

Honk Honk!
The swans are migrating to @DWNTWN_ORLANDO Creative Village! Beginning August 20, the new, driverless, fare-free SWAN Shuttle will scuttle passengers from Lynx Central Station through Creative Village on the LYMMO Orange Line.
@beepAVsolutions @lynxbusorlando pic.twitter.com/zMJhUmsCXZ

‚Äî City of Orlando (@citybeautiful) August 9, 2023

The city will begin with just one shuttle as a pilot program in order to test out the idea of a self-driving bus but they hope to expand the program to cover more areas, including the tourism corridor and areas surrounding major theme parks. Mayor Demmings shared his thoughts on tourism use saying, ‚Äúlook for the prospects‚Ä¶of not just having Beep and autonomous vehicles downtown but also in our International Drive corridor,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe prospects for that are great.‚Äù

Credit: City of Orlando

This means driverless busses could be coming to ‚Äúthe theme park part of town‚Äù in the very near future. We can‚Äôt wait to try out the Swan Shuttle for ourselves. Confession: we don‚Äôt always stay at a Universal Resort hotel when we visit the theme park. The convenience of a free shuttle we can feel good about environmentally rather than dealing with Universal‚Äôs hectic (and expensive) parking situation is something we greatly look forward to.¬† We will keep an eye on the shuttle and bring you updates as they develop.¬†

¬†

item.title: Urban heat islands: Map shows the hottest neighborhoods in San Diego
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: (NEXSTAR) ‚Äì¬†Does it feel like a totally different climate when you go across town? It may be the urban heat island effect. The way a city is designed can make hot weather feel even worse. The temperature on your block is influenced by everything from the number of trees on the street to the color ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
(NEXSTAR) ‚Äì¬†Does it feel like a totally different climate when you go across town? It may be the urban heat island effect.

The way a city is designed can make hot weather feel even worse. The temperature on your block is influenced by everything from the number of trees on the street to the color of the pavement. When trees and vegetation (which absorb heat) are replaced by buildings and roads (which can radiate heat), it feels hotter.

‚ÄúThe heat island effect can result in significant temperature differences between rural and urban areas,‚Äù explains the Environmental Protection Agency.


These areas of California could be underwater by 2050

Climate Central, an organization of scientists and journalists focused on studying the impacts of climate change, broke down 44 cities into Census blocks to determine which neighborhoods suffer from the worst urban heat effects.

You can see a map of San Diego County‚Äôs urban heat hot spots below.

San Diego County showed the worst impact concentration near downtown San Diego and neighboring cities Coronado, Chula Vista and National City, while the more rural areas in East and North County saw the least impact.

Those communities in the dark red portions of the map live in a Census tract where the urban heat effect is 8 degrees or higher ‚Äì¬†‚Äúmeaning that on a day when temperatures in a park outside the city are 90¬∞F, it feels like 98¬∞F or higher,‚Äù the report explains.

For each census tract, Climate Central researchers determined the urban heat index, which shows how much hotter it feels in those neighborhoods because of the built environment. The city with the worst urban heat index was New York, the analysis found.

In some cities, like Indianapolis, Albuquerque and San Jose, the worst impacts are concentrated in the cities‚Äô downtown cores. In other cities, like Dallas, Detroit and Phoenix, the urban heat effect is spread throughout.


COVID hospitalizations jump again: How bad is it in San Diego?

The map of hot spots around New York shows lots of neighborhoods shaded in dark red, with relief only to be found in the park-filled parts of Queens and on Staten Island.

The urban heat index is also high per capita in Chicago, but its hottest spots are more concentrated around The Loop.

About 52% of the city‚Äôs residents experience an urban heat index of 8 degrees or higher.

Los Angeles has what Climate Central calls ‚Äúsprawling heat intensity,‚Äù which means the urban heat effect happens over a vast area that is highly developed. Downtown Los Angeles and industrial areas are worst, but there are few pockets of the massive city where you can find an urban heat effect less than 7 degrees.

Denver, with its large areas of undeveloped land, had the Census tracts with the lowest scores. The wide open spaces around Denver International Airport recorded the lowest urban heat effect.

Downtown Denver, plus the area around Standley Lake, saw the highest scores.

Climate Matters analyzed the urban heat spots of 44 U.S. cities. (See all the maps and results here.)

The researchers also named a number of solutions ‚Äì both short-term and long-term ‚Äì to the urban heat problem. Planting trees can help, especially as those trees mature and grow larger to increase shade. Roof materials that reflect heat, as well as rooftop gardens, can cool things down in dense neighborhoods.

One of the hottest parts of any city is dark pavement that‚Äôs been soaking up the sun. Asphalt and concrete can even radiate heat after the sun goes down, keeping a neighborhood from cooling down at night. The EPA suggests looking into ‚Äúcool pavement‚Äù technology as a solution.

Suggest a Correction

item.title: Jet avoids Southwest Airlines Boeing 737 at San Diego International Airport
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: SAN DIEGO ‚Äî A Cessna Citation business jet was instructed to discontinue landing at the San Diego International Airport Friday to avoid a plane that was still on the runway. That‚Äôs according to the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), who told FOX 5 officials are investigating a ‚Äúgo-around‚Äù that occurred shortly before noon local time. This ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
SAN DIEGO ‚Äî A Cessna Citation business jet was instructed to discontinue landing at the San Diego International Airport Friday to avoid a plane that was still on the runway.

That‚Äôs according to the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), who told FOX 5 officials are investigating a ‚Äúgo-around‚Äù that occurred shortly before noon local time.


This weekend‚Äôs Perseid meteor shower will peak at this time in San Diego

The term ‚Äúgo-around‚Äù refers to flight procedure in which an arriving aircraft aborts its landing and returns to the landing queue. Officials say these instances are initiated if a pilot or air traffic controller is not completely satisfied that the requirements for a safe¬†landing are in place.

According to the FAA, preliminary review of the event showed that an air traffic controller instructed the pilot of a Cessna Citation business jet to discontinue landing because a Southwest Airlines Boeing 737 was still on the runway awaiting clearance to depart.

In the following statement, the FAA explained the situation further:

‚ÄúThe controller had previously cleared the Citation to land on Runway 27 and then instructed Southwest Flight 2493 to taxi onto that runway and wait for instructions to depart. The facility‚Äôs automated surface surveillance system alerted the controller about the developing situation.‚Äù

The FAA is sending a team of experts to the San Diego facility to investigate. Officials say the team will determine the closest proximity between the airplanes as part of the review.

The FAA held an industry-wide¬†Safety Summit earlier this year¬†on March 15. Since the summit, officials say the transportation agency has taken actions ‚Äúto ensure operations are conducted at the highest level of safety.‚Äù

‚ÄúOne close call is one too many,‚Äù the FAA stated.

Suggest a Correction

item.title: Star Party at Julian StarFest¬†amid Perseid meteor shower peak in San Diego
item.dc:creator: Chondrika Mondri
item.description: JULIAN, Calif. ‚Äî Astronomy enthusiasts and star gazers are in for special treat this weekend as the Perseid meteor shower is expected to peak over San Diego County. For those looking for the perfect place to watch this celestial event, the Julian StarFest is finally back after a two-year break due to the pandemic. This ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
JULIAN, Calif. ‚Äî Astronomy enthusiasts and star gazers are in for special treat this weekend as the Perseid meteor shower is expected to peak over San Diego County.

For those looking for the perfect place to watch this celestial event, the Julian StarFest is finally back after a two-year break due to the pandemic.


This weekend‚Äôs Perseid meteor shower will peak at this time in San Diego

The San Diego Astronomy Associations¬†is hosting a free public Star Party at the event Saturday night.

‚ÄúThis is definitely the big event for the meteor shower! There will be many astronomers there,‚Äù said Cathy Handzel, member of the San Diego County Chapter of the International Dark Sky Association (IDA).

Organizers are expecting around 1,000 people to attend the Julian StarFest, which is taking place below the dark skies at Menghini Winery.

The Star Party begins at 7 p.m. and will last until 11 p.m. Attendees can come early to check out merchant booths, participate in crafts in the picnic area, stroll the swap meet area, or enjoy wine tasting.

The full schedule for the Julian StarFest can be found here.

Associate Professor of Astronomy at San Diego State University, Douglas Leonard is set to speak at the Star Party with topics like the explosion of Betelgeuse ‚Äî a red supergiant star. He will be joined by other astronomy experts.

This year may prove better luck for sky gazers since the waning crescent moon will allow for better viewing compared to last year‚Äôs bright full Moon.

Julian may be one of the best places to catch this meteor shower as the Julian Dark Sky Network has worked to preserve its dark skies.

Suggest a Correction
